<Meta of={DemoStories} />

# Overview

The masked input component should be used to enter a text field that follows a specific format like Social a Security Number or a ZIP code.
The input mask allows to constrain the information being entered into that format, without impairing the user’s ability to copy/paste or correct mistyping.

This masking is based on the open source library [imaskJS](https://imask.js.org/). While this library supports other types of masks like Number or Date, this component should only be used for text fields.
For other field types like number, currency or date, it is recommended to use the correct field type in your data model and use the associated presentational component.

A pattern string is passed to the component as the 'mask' parameter to indicate how the text string should be formatted.

The supported values for the mask are:

- 0: Numeric (0–9)
- a: Alphabetical (a–z or A–Z)
- A: Uppercase alphabetical (A–Z)
- \*: Alphanumeric (0–9, a–z, or A–Z)
- [] - make input optional
- {} - include fixed part in unmasked value

## Examples

Enter an IBAN (International Bank Account Number) using the pattern 'AA00 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 A00':

<Story of={DemoStories.IBAN} />

Enter a credit card number using the pattern '0000 0000 0000 0000'':

<Story of={DemoStories.CreditCard} />

Enter an IP Address number using the pattern '0[00].0[00].0[00].0[00]':

<Story of={DemoStories.IPAddress} />

Enter a Zip Code (extended code optional) using the pattern '00000[-0000]':

<Story of={DemoStories.ZipCode} />

Enter a SSN (Social Security Number) using the pattern '000 00 0000':

<Story of={DemoStories.SSN} />
